column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Six Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Thursday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 681 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Thursday
column5: 848 on Wednesday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.There are 419 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column7: down from 427 on Wednesday.There are 34 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units
column8: up from 33 on Wednesday.Last updated 18 November at 14:00 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column10: 669 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Thursday.Last updated 18 November at 14:00 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 4
column11: 650 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Thursday
column13: 633 on Wednesday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column16: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.There are 643 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals.There are 118 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units.Last updated 18 November at 14:00 local timeSource: Department of Health IrelandA total of 7
column18: 732 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in the Republic of Ireland as of Tuesday.A total of 3

column24: 422 immunocompromised people have received their third dose.Last updated 18 November at 14:00 local timeSource: Department of Health Ireland
